poem:
"An Encore for Steve"

Starting as two, only to become one,
a melody composed under the softest sun.
Through films, TV's glow, Broadway's commanding stage,
Steve & Eydie, sans equal, set the age.
Love's song dutifully sung, till death did part,
now the spotlight dims on Steve's heartfelt art.
Alzheimer's curtain call, a cruel, unsought fate,
farewell, sweet troubadour, aged eighty eight.
